article:
'Dubai Crude' is a light sour crude oil extracted from Dubai. Dubai Crude is
used as a price benchmark or oil marker because it is one of only a few Persian
Gulf crude oils available immediately. The other two main oil markers are Brent
Crude and West Texas Intermediate.

Dubai Crude is generally used for pricing Persian Gulf crude oil exports
to Asia. The Dubai benchmark is also known as Fateh is used in the United
Arab Emirates. Forward trade of Dubai Crude is limited to one
or two months.

Dubai Crude is a light oil. It has a gravity of 31Â° API (specific gravity of
0.871) and a sulfur content of 2%/weight Supplement 3 (1997), Oil Trading
Manual, Long, D. (Ed.), Cambridge: Woodhead Publishing Limited.
